newsitem.title: USA: Homes sales in San Francisco area rise - report.
newsitem.headline: Homes sales in San Francisco area rise - report.

text.p: Home sales in the San Francisco Bay area continued at their brisk pace in July as interest rates remained stable and prices increased, a real estate information service said on Friday.

A total of 5,563 resale houses were sold in the nine-county region last month, up 1.5 percent from June's 5,480 and up 32.6 percent from 4,195 for July last year, according to DataQuick Information Systems.
Last month's year-over-year increase in home sales was the twelfth in a row, DataQuick said.
"We expect sales to stay strong, and price increases to level off a bit in the coming months," said Donald Cohn, DataQuick's chief executive officer.
The median price paid for a resale San Francisco Bay area house was $244,000 in July, down 1.2 percent from June's $247,000 and up 3.8 percent from $235,000 for July a year ago.
Price fluctuations are influenced by changes in home values and by shifts in market mix. Year-over-year prices have increased every month so far this year, DataQuick said.
The nine-county San Francisco Bay area region included Alameda, Contra Costa, Marin, Napa, San Francisco, San Mateo, Santa Clara, Solano and Sonoma.
